name: Tuver na Totha
description: Tuver na totha is simple, spicy and delicious North Gujarati winter recipe. Dry lentil is used to make this simple recipe. I used onion and spring onion with red chili, garlic, ginger to make tuver na totha.
ingredients: 1 Cup Tuver (lentil),1 cup Tomato puree,1 Onion (chopped),Ω cup Spring Onion,3 tsp Ginger Chili Paste,3 tsp Garlic (minced),1 Spring Onion for garnishing,Water according to requirement,,1 tbsp Oil,Pinch of Asafetida,Ω tsp Turmeric Powder,2 tsp Red Chili Powder,1 tsp Garam Masala Powder,Salt to taste
steps: Wash and soak tuver in warm water for 4-5 hour.,Drain water from it.,Add 1 glass water and salt in cooker.,Also add tuver and cook for 3-4 whistle at medium to slow flame.,After that you can check tuver.it is not soft, cook for extra 2-3 whistles.,Take 1 tbsp boiled tuver and crushed in a mixture jar.,Keep a side.,Heat oil in a pan at slow flame.,Add asafetida and onion in it.,Stir till color appears light golden.,Now add spring onion, ginger chili paste, garlic and salt in it.,Stir and cook for 1-2 minutes.,Now mix tomato puree and cook for few second.,By adding crushed tuver also cook for 2 minutes,,Now mix salt, turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala.,Stir for few seconds.,Add 1 cup water and tuver.,Cook for 10- 15 minutes at slow flame.,You can add more water according to your requirement.,Mix lemon juice to taste.,Garnish with spring onion.,Tuver na totha is ready for serve.

name: Dhokli nu Shaak (Step by Step)
description: Dhokli nu Shaak is one of famous Kathiyawadi Spicy recipes. This spicy curry is quick and easy to made chickpea recipes. There are many other variant of Dhokli nu shaak like Guvar Dhokli nu shaak, Fansi Dhokli nu shaak, Valor Dhokli nu shaak but here I post simple dhokli nu shaak. This spicy chickpea dumpling curry tastes awesome with rotli and kathiyawadi dish.
ingredients: 100 gm Chickpea flour,Salt to taste,Pinch of Turmeric powder,Ω tsp Chili powder,1 tsp Carom seeds (Ajwin),Pinch of Black Pepper powder,Water according to requirement,,1 tbsp Oil,5-6 Curry leaves,1 tsp Cumin seed,Pinch of Asafetida,Salt to taste,Ω tsp Garam Masala,1 cup Butter milk
steps: Mix chickpea flour, salt, chili powder, turmeric powder, carom seeds, black pepper powder.,Add water and mix well. It should be a batter form.,Boil water in a pan or in dhokla maker.,Grease dish with oil and pour batter on it.,Put dish on pan and cover it.,Cook for 10-15 minutes.,Remove from stove and cut into small pieces. keep  a side.,Heat oil in a pan at slow flame.,Add curry leaves and cumin seeds, asafetida in it.,When it is spluttering, add butter milk in it.,Also add salt and garam masala cook for 3-4 minutes at slow flame.,Mix dhokli in it.,Also cook for 3-4 minutes at slow flame.,Serve hot.

name: Kathiyawadi Mix Spicy Shaak
description: Kathiyawadi Mix Spicy Shaak is farmerÄôs food. Main ingredient of this spicy Kathiyawadi shaak is Eggplant, Peanut and Curd. This is simple but delicious vegetable recipe. In Kathiyawad, Farmer made these kind of shaak at farm with fresh vegetable. I tried this variant on my way. You can add more vegetable in it but eggplant with peanuts gives the best taste. Curd adds tangy taste in this shaak. Serve hot with Bajri Rotla, Green Chili, Garlic Chutney. I am sure, You will not forget taste.
ingredients: 2 medium sizes Ringan (White Eggplants fine chopped),1 medium size Onion (fine chopped),1.5 tsp Garlic Paste,2 cup Groundnut (crushed),1.5 cup Curd,,1.5 tbsp Oil,Ω tsp Turmeric powder,2 tsp Red Chili powder,1 tsp Cumin coriander powder,1 tsp Garam masala,Salt to taste,
steps: Wash eggplants and cut into very small pieces.,Heat oil in a pan at medium flame and add onion and garlic in it.,Also add eggplants in it and stir well.,Stir till eggplants become very soft.,Then add salt, turmeric powder, red chili powder and cumin coriander powder in it.,Mix well and add groundnuts and garam masala.,Cook for 1-2 minutes.,Last add curd and mix well.,Stir for few seconds and serve.,Serve hot with Rotla .

name: Bhinda Batata nu Shaak Äì Aloo Bhindi Subzi
description: Bhinda Batata nu Shaak (Aloo Bhindi Subzi Äì Okra Potato Recipe) is one of common and widely used recipe in Gujarat and North India. †It is easy and tasty lunch or dinner subzi. With these simple ingredients, you can make it very quick and easily. This spicy main dish is normally serve with Rotli and any lentil dishes. Must try this classic shallow fry vegetable dish.
ingredients: 250 gm ladyÄôs finger,2 Potatoes,,2 tbsp Oil,º of Cumin seed,Pinch of Asafetida,Ω tsp Turmeric powder,2 tsp Ginger chili paste,2.5 tsp Red chili powder,1 tsp Cumin coriander powder,Salt to taste
steps: Wash ladyÄôs finger, potatoes and cut in to long strip.,Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds in it.,When cumin seeds are spluttering, Add asafetida, turmeric powder, ginger chili paste, ladyÄôs finger, potatoes and salt in it.,Stir it properly.,Cook till both become soft.,Also mix cumin coriander powder and red chili powder.,Serve with regular dish.

name: Surti Papdi Nu Shaak
description: Surti Papdi nu Shaak is very popular Gujarati winter vegetable. It also known as Indian Beans. Papdi nu shaak is delicious, easy and quick to made vegetable. Normally Surti papdi is seasonal vegetable and available mostly during winter. Papdo nu shaak is serve with Rotli and Gujarati Thali.
ingredients: 200 gm Surti Papdi,Water according to requirement,,1 tbsp Oil,Ω tsp garlic paste,1 tsp Ginger chili paste,1 tsp Red chili powder,º tsp turmeric powder,1tsp cumin- coriander powder,Salt to taste,
steps: Wash and cut papdi.,Boil it in water by adding salt.,Boil till it becomes soft.,Drain water from it.,Now heat oil in a pan at slow flame.,Add garlic, ginger and chili paste.,Also add turmeric powder and papdi in it.,Stir and cook for 1 minute.,Last mix red chili powder and cumin coriander powder in it.,Serve with regular dish.

name: Mathri
description: MathriI(Flaky Biscuits) is Rajasthani Snack. Mathri is a tea time snack at my home. Mostly north Indian area is famous for this snack but we cannot tell that mathri is not a good home snack of Gujarat. Many types of mathari sell in namkeen shop like sweet mathri, spice mathri, plain mathari, methi mathari, etc. in between I have made it my home as a morning or afternoon snack. My hubby like mathri. Mathri is made by common kitchen ingredients. Though no need for outer ingredients. I have used maida (all purpose flour), wheat flour, salt, carom seeds, black paper powder. Here I took black paper powder but you can also use coarsely cursed black pepper. I have used ghee for softness. Mathri doesnÄôt take more time and easy recipe. But the main point is dough. It should not soft. So we should knead dough hard. So mathari make more soft, so oldies and small children also eat mathari easily. I like mathari with tea, green coriander chutney, and pickle. Enjoy no take more time mathari recipe.
ingredients: 200 gm All Purpose flour,100 gm Wheat flour,2 tsp Carom seeds (Ajwain),Salt to taste,Ω tsp Baking Soda,3 tbsp Ghee,1 tsp Black pepper (crushed)(optional),1 tsp Cumin seeds (optional),Water according to requirement,Oil for frying
steps: Sieve both flours in a bowl.,Add cumin seeds, salt and ghee.,Mix properly and add water.,Knead dough.,It should be hard.,Make medium balls from it.,Press balls with your palm or rolls out each ball in 1.5 inches.,Heat oil in a pan over medium flame.,Fry, all balls till it, appear golden brown in color.,Serve with tea.

name: Surti Sev Khamani
description: Sev Khamni is popular Gujarati Snacks from Surat area. Sev Khamni is traditionally made from Dhokla and also known as Amiri Khaman. Seasoning adds classic tastes in Sev Khamni. This gram lentils snacks is juicy, sweet and tangy. Normally, Sev Khamni is quick breakfast recipe but can match with regular Gujarati dish or as evening snacks also.
ingredients: 250 gm Chana dal,250 gm Sev,,For Seasoning,2 tsp Oil,Ω tsp Mustard seeds,2 tsp GingerÄìChili paste,1 tsp Lemon juice,Ω tbsp Coriander seeds,Salt to taste,2 tbsp Pomegranate,1 tbsp Coriander leaves,Water according to requirement
steps: Soak chana dal for 5-6 hour,Soak chana dal for 5-6 hour and drain water from it.,Grind coarsely.,Now take in a steel tied container and cook for 2-3 whistle in cooker.,Now heat oil in a pan at slow flame.,Add mustard seeds in it.,When it is spluttering, add ginger chili paste, salt, sugar and lemon juice in it.,Stir well for 10-15 minutes and cook till oil is separated.,Now keep in a dish and garnish with Sev, coriander leaves and pomegranate.

name: Deep Fry Peanuts
description: Deep Fried Peanuts is one of popular snacks food. It widely used in street food. †Fried peanuts is tastes delicious and gives extra texture and flavor. You can add more spices or herbs in this and make more delicious chaat or snacks. By adding Sindhalu Salt(Rock Salt), you can use it as fasting recipe also.
ingredients: 2 cup Peanuts,Salt to taste,1 tsp Red chili powder,1 tsp Cumin-Coriander powder,2 tsp Green Chili (fine chopped),1 tsp Lemon juice,1.5 tbsp Oil
steps: Heat oil in a pan at slow flame.,Shallow fry peanuts till color change.,Keep in a bowl and sprinkle salt, red chili powder, cumin-coriander powder.,Mix green chili and lemon juice on it.,Mix well and serve with any snacks.

name: Easy Butter Corn
description: Butter Corn is all time favorite snacks specially during monsoon. This recipe is simple and can make with lots other variants. More Unsalted butter adds delicious taste in butter corn. I normally prefer corn cobs to make this snacks.
ingredients: 4 cup Corn (Boiled),Ω tbsp Butter,Salt to taste,1 tsp Black pepper powder,Chili flakes according taste,Grated Cheese (Optional),1 tsp lemon juice,
steps: Remove skin from corn and wash it.,Add water and salt in cooker.,Heat water and add corn in a cooker.,Lid the cooker. Cook for 9-10 whistle.,When air is removed from cooker, open it.,Peel corn by using corn peeler.,Heat butter in a pan and add corn, black pepper powder or chili flakes and lemon juice.,Garnish with grated cheese and serve hot.

name: Tuver Lilva Kachori
description: Hot Kachori is one of favorite snacks during Winter and monsoon. Fresh Tuver is widely available during winter. Kachori filled with tuver stuffing & Green Chutney tastes delicious. There are many variants of Lilva Kachori but here I am posting easy and quick methods.
ingredients: 500 gm Tuver (Pigeon pea),1 tbsp Ginger chili paste,Salt to taste,Pinch of Cumin seeds,Pinch of Asafetida,Ω tsp Turmeric powder,1 tsp Garam masala,1 tsp Lemon juice,Ω tbsp Coriander leaves (chopped),1 tbsp oil,,300 gm all purpose flour (maida),Salt to taste,1 tbsp Ghee,Water according to requirement,4-5 drop oil,Oil for frying
steps: Sieve flour and add salt, ghee in it.,Mix and add water to make dough.,Dough should be not more soft and hard.,Add oil and knead very well.,Keep a side.,Crush tuver in a chili cutter.,Heat oil in a pan at slow flame.,Add cumin seeds in it.,When it is spluttering, add asafetida and turmeric powder.,Also mix tuver, ginger chili paste and salt.,Cover lid and cook till it becomes soft.,Remove lid and mix garam masala and lemon juice.,Cook for 2-3 minutes and add coriander leaves in it.,Make medium balls from dough and roll out like small puri.,Feel stuffing in puri.,Cover it like potli or round shape.,If you make potli , seal all edge properly.,Heat oil in a pan at medium flame.,Deep fry kachori till golden brown appearance.,Serve with Green Chutney and sweet chutney.

name: Mamra Na Ladoo (Puffed Rice Balls)
ingredients: 150 gm Mamra,250 gm Jaggery,Ω tbsp Ghee,
steps: Roast mamra.,Heat ghee in a pan at slow flame.,Add shredded jaggery and cook till color change and appears thick.,Add roasted mamra in it.,Mix well. Remove from flame.,Make ladoo shape from mixture.,Mamra ladoo is ready for serve.

name: Sandwich Dhokla
description: Sandwich Dhokla is spicy variant of famous Gujarati snacks Dhokla. Sandwich dhokla is spicer version of White Dhokla, made from rice and udad dal. †In this recipe, chutney is used in between two white dhokla or two different types of dhoklas. You can try with combination of white and yellow dhoklas or your own creations. Preparing Sandwich Dhokla is as easy as other dhoklas.
ingredients: 1 cup Jeerasar or Basmati Rice,1/4 cup Urad dal (Black gram dal),1 cup Curd,1.5 tsp Baking soda or fruit salt,2 tsp Ginger chili paste,2 tbsp Coriander Chutney,Salt to taste,Water according to requirement,,Ω tbsp Oil,1 tsp Mustard seeds,5-6 Curry leaves,Ω tsp Sesame seeds,
steps: Wash and soak rice and urad dal in water for 4-5 hour separately.,After 4-5 hours, drain water from both.,Grind it in mixture jar with curd and water according requirement.,Grind till it become like medium batter.,It should not be very thick or thin.,Keep it in a warm place for 5-6 hour for fermentation.,In a bowl, add salt and eno in it. Mix properly.,Heat water in a steamer at medium flame.,Grease plates with oil.,Now pour1/4 cup batter in it.,Cover lid and cook for approx 5 minutes.,Pour chutney on it and again pour 1/4 cup batter on it.,Again cover lid and cook for 10-15 minutes.,Open and check with knife.,Remove plate from steamer and cut into square pieces.,Heat oil in a pan at slow flame.,Add curry leaves, mustard seeds, sesame seeds in it.,When it is spluttering, pour this seasoning on Dhokla.,Mix well and serve with coriander chutney.

name: Chorafali or Chorafali Fafda
description: Chorafali or Chorafali Fafda is Gujarati festival snack specially on Vijayadashmi and Diwali. This gluten free crispy vegan snack is perfect for munching and evening snacks. Combination of chickpea flour and urad flour gives awesome tastes. †I often made this recipe during summer vacations.
ingredients: 250 gm Chickpea flour (Besan),100 gm Urad flour,1 tbsp Rice flour,Pinch of Baking soda,1 tbsp Oil,Salt to Taste,Oil for Frying,1 tsp Black salt,1 tsp Red chili powder,1 cup warm Water,
steps: First take chickpea flour and Urad flour in mixing bowl.,Add salt, soda, 1 tbsp oil and mix well.,Add water and make medium dough.,Add 1 tsp oil and again knead dough.,Make medium balls from it.,Cover balls with rice flour and roll out each roll like thin roti.,Cut them in to long strips.,Heat oil in a pan at medium flame.,Fry all strip in it.,Sprinkle black salt and red chili powder.,Chorafali is ready for serve, serve with Mint chutney.

name: White Dhokla
description: White Dhokla (Rice flour Dhokla) is one of the famous Gujarati Dhokla variants. This spongy dhokla is easy to made and one of must recipe in Gujarati Thali.
ingredients: 1.5 cup Rice (you can use jeerasar or boiled rice),1/2 cup Urad dal (Black gram dal),Salt to taste,2 cup Curd or 4 cup Butter milk,1 small packet Eno or 1.5 tsp Baking soda,1 tbsp Black pepper powder,Water according to requirement,
steps: Wash and soak rice and urad dal in water for 4-5 hour separately.,After 4-5 hours, drain water from both.,Grind it in mixture jar with butter milk and water according requirement.,Grind till it become medium batter.,It should not be very thick or thin.,Keep it in a warm place for 5-6 hour for fermentation.,In a bowl add salt and eno in it. Mix properly.,Heat water in a steamer at medium flame.,Grease plate with oil.,Now pour approx 2 cup batter in it.,Sprinkle black pepper powder on it.,Cover lid and cook for approx 15 minutes.,Open and check with knife.,Remove plate from steamer and cut into diamond pieces.,Hot serve with Garlic chutney and Green chutney.

name: Quick Thick Poha Chivda
ingredients: 150 gm Rice flakes (Pauva),50 gm Ground peanuts,5-6 Curry leaves,1 tbsp Fennel seeds,2 tsp Turmeric powder,1 tbsp Sugar powder,2 tsp Amchur powder,Ω liter Oil for frying,Salt to taste
steps: Heat oil in a pan at medium flame.,Fry peanuts at slow flame in hot oil.,Keep a side also fry one cup rice flakes in that oil.,Repeat for other flakes and keep a side.,Heat 1 tsp oil in a pan and add curry leaves and fennel seeds in it.,Also add turmeric powder and mix with flakes and peanuts.,Stir well, also mix salt, sugar powder and amchur powder.,Thick poha chivda is ready to eat.

name: Gujarati Chakri (Wheat Flour Chakli Recipe)
description: Wheat flour chakli is one of popular snacks. This wheel shape crunchy snacks normally made during festivals specially Janmastami and Diwali. We normally serve chakri with tea and other snacks to guests.
ingredients: 250 gm wheat flour,2 tbsp Oil,1 tbsp sesame seeds,Salt to taste,Oil for frying,Water according to requirement,1.5 tbsp ginger chili paste,2 tsp turmeric powder,
steps: First take wheat flour in mixing bowl.,Add salt, turmeric powder and mix it.,Tie flour in to the cotton clothes.,Steam it in to cooker and Cook for 15 minutes.,Keep a side and cool down it.,Break the lumps formed.,Sieve the flour in to other vessel.,Add ginger garlic paste, sesame seeds and oil in it.,Knead dough mix 1 tsp oil and also knead it.,Put dough in to frying spoon.,Heat oil in a pan at medium flame.,Press frying spoon to make chakri.,Fry it till it becomes crispy.,Repeat for other chakri.,Take out in to other dish.,Store in to air tied container for 15-20days.

name: Mirch Pakora (Marcha na  Bhajiya)
ingredients: 150 gm chickpea flour,10 green chilies,Salt to taste,º tsp baking soda,Ω tsp black pepper powder,1 tbsp lemon juice,Water according to requirement,Oil for frying,
steps: Wash chili and cut in to two parts.(long straight cut),Remove seeds from it.,Sprinkle black pepper powder and lemon juice on it. Keep a side.,Sieve flour in bowl.,Add salt, baking soda and 1 tsp lemon juice in it.,Add water and make batter.,Batter should be medium.,Heat oil in a pan at medium flame.,Take 5-6 chili cuts and properly deep in batter.,With help of finger put bhajiya in oil.,Deep fry it till it becomes light golden in color.,Serve with curd chutney, tamarind chutney and green chutney also.

name: Kachi Keri Ki Chutney Äì Raw Mango Chutney
description: I usually made Raw Mango chutney during mango season. Kachi keri ki chutney can serve with anything like rotiÄìsubzi, dal-rice or as side dish, even I ate it with toasted bread also. Raw mango chutney tastes sour and sweet. Mango chutney is easy to make and tastes delicious. Sometime I add more chili or chili powder to make it spicier.
ingredients: 2 small row Mangoes,4 Green Chili (chopped),1 tbsp Ground nuts,Salt to taste,Ω tsp Turmeric powder,Ω tsp Sugar,
steps: Pill mangoes and cut into small pieces.,Take mango pieces, chili, ground nuts, turmeric powder salt and sugar in mixture jar.,Mix all ingredients and grind properly.

name: Mint Chutney Äì Pudina Chutney Äì Green Chutney
description:
Pudina chutney is a spicy dip. Mint chutney can serve with any Indian snacks like Samosa, Bhel, Pakodas, Kababs, Biryani, Sandwiches, Rice or with main course. It gives delicious fresh tastes and vibrant color in recipes. Mint has good nutrition value also.PrintMint Chutney Äì Pudina Chutney Äì Green ChutneyRating: 51Prep Time: 5 minutesCook Time: 5 minutesTotal Time: 10 minutesServing Size: 4
Ingredients100 gm Mint leaves15 Garlic cloves2 tsp lemon juice4 to 5 green chiliesA small piece of gingerSalt to tasteInstructionsGrind the all ingredients.Add some water and grind again.Mint Chutney is ready to use.NotesServe fresh or store in fridge to maintain its green color and freshness.3.1
ingredients: 100 gm Mint leaves,15 Garlic cloves,2 tsp lemon juice,4 to 5 green chilies,A small piece of ginger,Salt to taste
steps: Grind the all ingredients.,Add some water and grind again.,Mint Chutney is ready to use.

name: Mango Pickle Äì Aam Ka Achar Äì Keri nu Athanu
description: Summer means Mango season and Pickle season. Most of Gujarati houses stores whole year mango pickles.
ingredients: 1 kg Raw Mango,125 gm Coarsely Fenugreek seeds (Kuriya),75 gm Coarsely Mustard seeds (Kuriya),50 gm Coarsely Fennel seeds (kuriya),1 tbsp Black Pepper,1 tbsp Turmeric powder,3 tbsp Red Chili Powder,Salt to taste,Oil according to requirement
steps: Wash mango and cut into 1-2 inch pieces.,Mix turmeric powder and salt in it.,Mix well and remain it in approx 2-3 hour.,During this time, after every half hours mix well.,Then drain water from mango and dry properly.,It should not be moistly.,Heat oil in a pan and allow cooling at room temperature.,Take mango in a bowl and add salt, mustard seeds, fenugreek seeds, black pepper, fennel seeds and red chili powder in it.,Add oil and mix properly.,Keep it in this condition approx 4- 5 hour.,Now store in a glass jar or ceramic jar and add 2 inch oil above the pickle level to store it till next season.

name: Lemon Chutney
ingredients: 1 cup Lemon Juice,Ω tbsp Jaggary,1 tsp Cumin coriander powder,1 tsp Red chili powder,º tsp Garam masala,1 tsp coriander leaves (chopped),Salt to taste

name: Ginger Chutney Äì Adrakh ki Chutney
ingredients: 2 Dry Red Chilies,Ω tsp Mustard seeds,Ω tsp Cumin seeds,5 Curry leaves,2 tbsp Oil

name: Garlic Chutney Äì Losney Chutney
ingredients: 30 to 35 cloves garlic,5 tbsp Red Chili powder,5 Spoon Oil,1 tsp Cumin Seed,Salt to taste

name: Bharela Tameta (Stuffed Tomato)
description:
Chilled†Tomato is delicious snack or side dish for all season. Here I made variant of Cold Tomato†known†Bharela Tameta in Gujarati. Stuffed tomato is quick and easy to made side dish. Poha stuffing adds delicious taste to chilled tomatoes.
PrintBharela Tameta (Stuffed Tomato)Rating: 51Prep Time: 10 minutesCook Time: 10 minutesTotal Time: 20 minutesServing Size: 4
Ingredients7-8 Tomatoes1 tbsp Coriander leavesFor Stuffing3 tbsp Coconut (grated)1 tbsp Coriander seeds2 tsp Chili pastePinch of turmeric powder2 tsp Red chili powder2 tsp cumin powderSalt to taste2 tsp Sugar powder1 tbsp Ground nut (crushed)1 tsp Garam masalaWater according to requirementInstructionsMix all stuffing ingredients and keep a side.Wash tomatoes and remove its upper part slight.Cut tomato in to 4 parts carefully not whole.Feel stuffing in all tomatoes.Serve as side dish.3.1
ingredients: 7-8 Tomatoes,1 tbsp Coriander leaves,,3 tbsp Coconut (grated),1 tbsp Coriander seeds,2 tsp Chili paste,Pinch of turmeric powder,2 tsp Red chili powder,2 tsp cumin powder,Salt to taste,2 tsp Sugar powder,1 tbsp Ground nut (crushed),1 tsp Garam masala,Water according to requirement
steps: Mix all stuffing ingredients and keep a side.,Wash tomatoes and remove its upper part slight.,Cut tomato in to 4 parts carefully not whole.,Feel stuffing in all tomatoes.,Serve as side dish.

name: Dahi Vada Äì Dahi Bhalla
description: Dahi vada (Dahi Bhalla, Thayir Vadai, Thayir Vada, Perugu Vada, Dahi Bara) is famous Indian Chaat, prepared by soaking dal vadas with dahi. There are many names of dahi vada but all tastes delicious.
ingredients: 1 cup choli (cowÄôs pea dal),1 cup urad dal,Ω cup mung dal,Salt to taste,Oil for frying,2 pinch red chili powder,1 liters  curd,2 tbsp powder sugar,Ω tbsp roasted cumin seeds,Water according to requirement,,Add sugar according taste in to curd,Beat it properly.,
steps: Soak all dals for 4-5 hour.,Drain water from it.,Add water and salt in dal.,Grind it properly in a mixture jar like smooth paste.,Paste should be thick.,Heat oil in a pan at medium flame.,Add and mix 1 tbsp better in a oil with hand.,Fry vadas now.,Take water in a bowl.,Soak vada for1-2 minutes in water.,Slowly press vada with your palm and remove water from it.,Keep a side.,Add 3 pinch salt and powder sugar in curd,Mix it properly.,Now pour curd on vadas and sprinkle roasted cumin seeds and red chili powder.,Garnish with coriander leave.

name: Homemade Cucumber Raita
description: Cucumber Raita is famous Indian raita (Yogurt sauce). Cool yogurts, fresh cucumbers and spices balanced spicy Indian foods. It tastes delicious with paratha and any spicy Indian veg. Mint or cilantro with jeera adds awesome tastes. Raitas serves with biryanis, spicy rice also.
ingredients: 1 Cucumber,2 cup Curd,Salt to taste,1 tsp Sugar powder,º tsp Roasted cumin powder,º tsp Red chili powder,Coriander leaves or Mint leaves for garnish
steps: Peel and grate half cucumber.,Other half cucumber cut in to small pieces.,Beat curd and add salt, sugar.,Mix very well.,Mix grated cucumber and add cucumber pieces in it.,Sprinkle red chili powder and roasted cumin powder.,Garnish with coriander leaves or mint leaves.,Raita is ready for serve.

name: Crunchy Cabbage Chili Salad Äì Cabbage Chili Sambharo
description: Cabbage Chili Sambharo (Crunchy Cabbage Chili Salad) is traditional kathiyawadi salad. Sambharo is easy to made, delicious and†nutrients salad. Like other Sambhara, this cabbage chili sambharoÄôs flavor will win your heart.†Asafetida adds delicious taste in cabbage.
ingredients: 6 cup Cabbage finely chopped,6-7 green Chili (small pieces),,1.5 tbsp Oil,1 tsp Mustard seeds,1 tsp Turmeric powder,Salt to taste
steps: Heat oil in a pan at medium flame.,Add mustard seeds in oil.,When it splutters, add turmeric powder, cabbage,  chili, salt in it and stir it properly.,Cook for 4-5 minutes (till cabbage become soft) at slow flame. DonÄôt cover the lid.,When it becomes soft, Sambharo is ready for serve.,You can serve with Gathiya, Roti, Rotalo, Bhakhari also.

name: Keri Gajar Nu Athanu Äì Aam ka Achar
description:
Gujarati People made athanu with raw mangoes and preserve it for whole year. It made from raw mango, mix vegetables, oil and spices. It taste spicy and delicious. There are lots of variant of athanu. Here I made Aam ka achar with carrot. 
PrintKeri Gajar Nu Athanu - Aam ka AcharRating: 51Prep Time: 10 minutesCook Time: 15 minutesTotal Time: 25 minutesServing Size: 4Athanu (Mango Pickle) is traditional Gujarati salad or snacks. Traditionally farmer ate athanu with bhakhri or roti in lunch.Ingredients2 Raw Mangoes2 CarrotsSalt to taste2 tbsp coarsely mustard seedsΩ tbsp fennel seeds2 tsp red chili powderPinch of asafetida3 tbsp oilInstructionsWash and cut carrot into small pieces.Also wash and cut raw mangoes into small pieces.Mix coarsely mustard seeds, fennel seeds, salt, asafetida, red chili powder and oil in itAdd carrot and mango pieces in it.Mix it well.Store in it air tied container in a refrigerator.Serve with Roti, Bhakhari , Paratha and Thepla.NotesYou can add citric acid as a preservative.3.1
ingredients: 2 Raw Mangoes,2 Carrots,Salt to taste,2 tbsp coarsely mustard seeds,Ω tbsp fennel seeds,2 tsp red chili powder,Pinch of asafetida,3 tbsp oil,
steps: Wash and cut carrot into small pieces.,Also wash and cut raw mangoes into small pieces.,Mix coarsely mustard seeds, fennel seeds, salt, asafetida, red chili powder and oil in it,Add carrot and mango pieces in it.,Mix it well.,Store in it air tied container in a refrigerator.,Serve with Roti, Bhakhari , Paratha and Thepla.

name: Marcha no Sambharo
description: PrintMarcha no SambharoRating: 51Prep Time: 5 minutesCook Time: 5 minutesTotal Time: 10 minutesServing Size: 4Marcha no Sambharo (Sauteed Chilli) is well known Gujarati side dish. It is favorite side dish for spicy Gujarati food lover.Ingredients6-7 green chilies (long cut)1 cup chickpea flour (roasted)For seasoning2 tbsp OilΩ tsp Mustard seedsΩ tsp Turmeric powderSalt to tasteInstructionsCut chilies in to long pieces.Then heat oil in a pan at slow flame.Add muster seeds in it.When it is spluttering, add turmeric powder, chilies and salt in it.Stir properly. Cook for 5 minutes at slow flame.Sprinkle water on chilies.Now add chickpea flour in pan.Mix it properly and. cook for 2 minutes.Chilies sambharo is ready for serve.You can serve with rotlo, Rotli , bhakhari also.3.1
ingredients: 6-7 green chilies (long cut),1 cup chickpea flour (roasted),,2 tbsp Oil,Ω tsp Mustard seeds,Ω tsp Turmeric powder,Salt to taste,
steps: Cut chilies in to long pieces.,Then heat oil in a pan at slow flame.,Add muster seeds in it.,When it is spluttering, add turmeric powder, chilies and salt in it.,Stir properly. Cook for 5 minutes at slow flame.,Sprinkle water on chilies.,Now add chickpea flour in pan.,Mix it properly and. cook for 2 minutes.,Chilies sambharo is ready for serve.,You can serve with rotlo, Rotli , bhakhari also.

name: Pudina Green Aloo
ingredients: 1 kg Potatoes (medium size),50 gm Fresh Mint leaves,50 gm Coriander (chopped),10-12 Black Pepper,5-6 Green Chilis,1 piece of Ginger,4-5 Curry leaves,1 tsp Cumin Powder,Salt to taste,1 tsp lemon Juice,2 tsp Oil for Seasoning,Water according to requirement,,2-3 Mint Leaves,Salted Peanuts (without skin),1 Green Chili,
steps: Wash and boiled potatoes in a cooker for 3-4 whistle at medium to slow flame.,Peel potatoes and cut into medium pieces.,Mix black pepper, green chili, ginger, curry leaves, mint leaves and coriander leaves.,Blend it properly in mixture jar.,Add water according to requirement and again blend and keep aside.,Heat oil in a pan on medium flame.,Add paste into oil. name: Farali Aloo Pudla (Potato Roasties)
description: Ahhhhh, mouth watering aloo pudla. †Aloo pudla is a farali recipe. I love this shallow fry fasting recipe. I tried after seeing TV cooking show. It consists of potatoes, ginger chili paste, chat masala and amchur powder. So roasties have light sour and spicy taste. Main ingredient is potatoes. I have used oil for binding potato mixture. During fast I make many fasting dishes but this is my favorite one. I make suki bhaji, sabudana khichadi, sabudana tikki with potato roasties. I serve aloo pudla with coriander chutney and sauce. Hope you will go simple and easy potato roasteis. Try it and enjoy.

steps: Wash potatoes and peel.,Grate potatoes properly.,Add salt, ginger chili paste, chat masala, amchur powder, and coriander leaves.,Mix well and add oil in it.,Also, mix oil properly.,Then heat a nonstick pan over the slow flame.,Take 1 tsp oil on the pan.,Pour approx 1 tbsp mixture in the pan.,Gently spread with soon and make a thick round shape.,Sprinkle little amount oil on it.,Cook it for 8 10 minutes at medium flame.,Turn and also cook another side same method.,It appears like the light brown color.,Serve with coriander chutney and mint chutney.

description: Sabudana Kheer (Sago Pearls Kheer) is fast or Vrat Recipe. I made this Tapioca Pearls Kheer during fast and as desserts†during Summers. This recipe is as easy to made like Rice Kheer. I always made this pudding during religious fast.

description: Amla Juice (Indian Gooseberry Juice) is healthy drink. Amla is very healthy fruit and widely used during winter. Amla is enrich with iron, vitamin C and other nutritional benefits. name: Crispy Karela Batata Fry
ingredients: 4 Karela (Bitter Gourd),2 Potatoes,Oil for frying,Salt to taste,1 tsp Red chili powder,1 tsp Cumin coriander powder,Ω tsp Lemon juice,1Ω  tsp Sugar powder

name: Dudhi Chana dal nu Shaak Äì Lauki Chana Dal Sabji

name: Kaju Karela (Cashew Nuts Äì Bitter Gourd Sabji)
ingredients: 3 Karela (Bitter Gourd),2 Onions,Ω cup Cashew nuts,Oil for frying,Salt to taste,1 tsp Red chili flakes,Ω tsp Garm masala,1 tsp Lemon juice

ingredients: 1 cup Chori (black eyed peas),Water according to requirement,Salt to taste,1 Onion slice,,Ω tbsp Oil,Ω tsp Cumin seeds,1 cup Tomato puree,º tsp Turmeric powder,1 tsp Ginger garlic paste,1 tsp Red chili powder,Ω tsp Garam masala

name: Bataka-Sabudana Ni Tikki (Potato-Sago Tikki)
ingredients: 4 potatoes,1 cup Sago balls (Sabudana),1.5 tbsp Starch powder,Ω tsp Black pepper powder,1 tsp Sugar powder,2 tsp Lemon juice,2 tsp Ginger Äì garlic paste,2 tsp Red chili powder,Salt to taste,Oil for frying,

name: Gujarati Undhiyu
description:

Serves4

Serve Hot
Undhiyu is most popular mixed vegetable Gujarati dish. Traditionally Undhiyu cooked in upside down matlu(pot). There are many variant of undhiyu like Surti Undhiyu, Kathiyawadi Undhiyu, Gujarati Undhiyu.  It is normally winder dish. It is Uttrayan festival food also.IngredientsMuthiya100g Chickpea Flour25g Fenugreek (methi) Leaves (Finely Chopped)1/2 teaspoon Garam Masala1/2 teaspoon Red Chili Powder1/4 teaspoon Turmeric Powder1 teaspoon Cumin-coriander Powder250 teaspoons Oil175 teaspoons SugarSalt For Taste1 cup WaterUndhiyu2 Onions (Finely Chopped)50g Green Peas100g Curry Flower2 tablespoons Garlic Paste2 tablespoons Ginger paste2 teaspoons Lemon Juice2 teaspoons Green Chili Paste1 teaspoon Sugar1 teaspoon Garam Masala2 teaspoons Red Chili Powder1/2 teaspoon Turmeric Powder1 teaspoon Cumin-Coriander PowderSalt to Taste2 Tomatoes (Chopped)10g Coriander Leaves250g Potatoes (Chopped)150g Yam (Chopped)200g Brinjal (Chopped)50g Cluster beans (Guvar) (Finely Chopped)4 Red Chilies DriedNoteSo Undhiyu is ready for serve.† You can serve it with Puri, Roti or Paratha.You can add more green chili and garam masala to make it spicy. Even you can add more vegetables like fresh bean, kidney bean, lila chana and more kathod to it also.
Directions
Method for MuthiyaChop methi leaves finely and wash it and strain them. Now add salt to methi leaves. Keep a side for few times. Now remove the excess water from methi leaves.Now mix chickpea flour, salt, turmeric powder, red chili powder, cumin coriander powder, sugar, oil with methi leaves.Mix well. Knead the dough. Make hard dough. Divide dough in to small ball called it Muthiya in Gujarati. Deep fry the muthiyas till turn golden.
Method for UndhiyuWash and peel the potatoes, yam, cluster bean, curry flower, brinjal in to medium size pieces.
Heat enough oil in kadai.Add whole red chili (dried), chopped tomatoes, chopped onion and pinch of asafetida.Add salt, turmeric powder, red chili powder, sugar, lemon juice, green chili, ginger paste, garlic paste and mix well.Then add all vegetable in kadai and garam masala powder and mix them well and cover with lid.Cook it till it become soft. They may also be cooked in pressure cooker for two whistles.After that add muthiya in it cook for few minutes and mix well.Garnish with coriander leaves.

name: Dhokla
description: Traditional steamed lentil cakes
ingredients: 1 cup Besan (chickpea flour), 1/4 cup Semolina, 1/2 cup Yogurt, 1 tsp Turmeric powder, 1 tbsp Ginger-green chili paste, Salt to taste, 1 tsp Eno (fruit salt), 1 tbsp Oil, 1 tsp Mustard seeds, 1 tsp Sesame seeds, 2 tbsp Chopped coriander leaves, 2 tbsp Grated coconut, 1 Green chili (sliced), 1 tsp Lemon juice
steps: 1. In a mixing bowl, combine besan, semolina, and yogurt. 2. Add turmeric powder, ginger-green chili paste, and salt. Mix well to form a smooth batter. 3. Allow the batter to rest for 30 minutes. 4. Grease a steamer or dhokla plates. 5. Add Eno to the batter and mix well. 6. Pour the batter into the greased plates. Steam for 15-20 minutes until dhokla is cooked. 7. In a pan, heat oil and add mustard seeds, sesame seeds, and green chili. 8. Once they splutter, pour this tempering over the steamed dhokla. 9. Garnish with chopped coriander leaves, grated coconut, and lemon juice. 10. Cut into squares and serve.

name: Undhiyu
description: Traditional mixed vegetable dish
ingredients: 1 cup Surati papdi (hyacinth beans), 1 cup Surti lilva (pigeon peas), 1 cup Small brinjals (halved), 1 cup Sweet potatoes (cubed), 1 cup Purple yam (cubed), 1 cup Green beans (chopped), 1 cup Fresh tuvar (pigeon pea pods), 1 cup Potatoes (cubed), 1 cup Raw bananas (cubed), 1/2 cup Fresh coriander leaves (chopped), 1/4 cup Fresh coconut (grated), 2 tbsp Sesame seeds, 2 tbsp Peanuts, 2 tbsp Jaggery (grated), 3 tbsp Oil, 1 tsp Mustard seeds, 1 tsp Cumin seeds, 1/2 tsp Asafoetida, 1 tbsp Ginger-green chili paste, 1 tsp Turmeric powder, 2 tsp Coriander-cumin powder, Salt to taste
steps: 1. Prepare all the vegetables and keep aside. 2. In a pan, dry roast sesame seeds and peanuts until golden. 3. Grind the roasted sesame seeds and peanuts to make a coarse powder. 4. Heat oil in a large pot. Add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and asafoetida. 5. Add ginger-green chili paste and sautÈ for a minute. 6. Add all the vegetables, turmeric powder, coriander-cumin powder, and salt. Mix well. 7. Cover and cook on low heat until the vegetables are tender. 8. Once the vegetables are cooked, add the ground sesame-peanut powder, grated coconut, and chopped coriander leaves. 9. Mix well and cook for an additional 5 minutes. 10. Garnish with grated jaggery and serve hot.

name: Fafda
description: Crispy gram flour strips
ingredients: 2 cups Gram flour (besan), 1/4 cup Semolina, 1 tsp Red chili powder, 1/2 tsp Turmeric powder, 1/2 tsp Baking soda, Salt to taste, 1 tbsp Oil, Water (as needed), Oil for frying
steps: 1. In a bowl, mix gram flour, semolina, red chili powder, turmeric powder, baking soda, salt, and oil. 2. Gradually add water to form a smooth, stiff dough. 3. Heat oil in a pan for frying. 4. Roll out portions of the dough into thin strips (fafda). 5. Deep-fry until golden and crispy. 6. Serve with green chutney and jalebi.

name: Handvo
description: Savory lentil cake
ingredients: 1 cup Rice, 1/2 cup Toor dal, 1/4 cup Chana dal, 1/4 cup Urad dal, 1/2 cup Yogurt, 1/2 cup Bottle gourd (grated), 1/4 cup Carrot (grated), 1/4 cup Green peas, 1/4 cup Corn kernels, 1 tbsp Ginger-green chili paste, 1/2 tsp Turmeric powder, 1 tsp Red chili powder, 1 tsp Mustard seeds, 1 tsp Cumin seeds, 2 tbsp Oil, Salt to taste
steps: 1. Soak rice and dals together for 5-6 hours. Grind to make a thick batter. 2. Add yogurt, grated bottle gourd, carrot, green peas, corn, ginger-green chili paste, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well. 3. In a tempering pan, heat oil and add mustard seeds and cumin seeds. 4. Pour the tempering into the batter and mix. 5. Pour the batter into a greased pan and bake until golden brown. 6. Slice and serve.

name: Khandvi
description: Soft gram flour rolls
ingredients: 1 cup Gram flour (besan), 1 cup Yogurt, 1/2 tsp Turmeric powder, 1 tsp Ginger-green chili paste, Salt to taste, 1 tbsp Oil, 1 tsp Mustard seeds, 1 tsp Cumin seeds, 1/2 tsp Asafoetida, 2 tbsp Fresh coconut (grated), 2 tbsp Coriander leaves (chopped)
steps: 1. Mix gram flour, yogurt, turmeric powder, ginger-green chili paste, and salt. 2. Cook the mixture on low heat until it thickens. 3. Quickly spread a thin layer on a greased surface. 4. Once set, cut into strips and roll into rolls. 5. For tempering, heat oil and add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and asafoetida. 6. Pour over the rolls. 7. Garnish with grated coconut and chopped coriander leaves. 8. Serve chilled.

name: Gujarati Kadhi
description: Yogurt-based soup
ingredients: 1 cup Yogurt, 2 tbsp Besan (gram flour), 1/2 tsp Turmeric powder, 1 tsp Ginger-green chili paste, Salt to taste, 1 tbsp Ghee, 1 tsp Mustard seeds, 1 tsp Cumin seeds, 1/2 tsp Fenugreek seeds, 2 Dried red chilies, 5-6 Curry leaves, 2 tbsp Fresh coriander leaves (chopped)
steps: 1. Whisk yogurt, besan, turmeric powder, ginger-green chili paste, and salt. 2. In a pan, heat ghee and add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, fenugreek seeds, dried red chilies, and curry leaves. 3. Pour the yogurt mixture into the pan and cook on low heat until it thickens. 4. Garnish with chopped coriander leaves. 5. Serve with rice or khichdi.

name: Thepla
description: Spiced flatbread with fenugreek
ingredients: 2 cups Whole wheat flour, 1/2 cup Gram flour (besan), 1/2 cup Fenugreek leaves (finely chopped), 1/2 cup Yogurt, 1 tsp Ginger-green chili paste, 1/2 tsp Turmeric powder, 1 tsp Red chili powder, 1 tsp Cumin powder, Salt to taste, 1 tbsp Oil, Water (as needed), Ghee (for cooking)
steps: 1. In a bowl, mix whole wheat flour, gram flour, fenugreek leaves, yogurt, ginger-green chili paste, turmeric powder, red chili powder, cumin powder, salt, and oil. 2. Knead into a soft dough using water. 3. Divide the dough into small balls. 4. Roll each ball into a flatbread (thepla). 5. Cook on a hot griddle with ghee until golden brown. 6. Serve with yogurt or pickles.

name: Gujarati Dal
description: Sweet and tangy lentil soup
ingredients: 1 cup Toor dal, 1/2 cup Yellow moong dal, 1 tsp Ginger-green chili paste, 1/2 tsp Turmeric powder, 1/2 tsp Mustard seeds, 1/2 tsp Cumin seeds, 1/4 tsp Asafoetida, 2 Dried red chilies, 5-6 Curry leaves, 2 tbsp Jaggery, Tamarind pulp (to taste), Salt to taste, 2 tbsp Fresh coriander leaves (chopped)
steps: 1. Cook toor dal and moong dal with turmeric powder until soft. 2. In a pan, heat oil and add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, asafoetida, dried red chilies, and curry leaves. 3. Add ginger-green chili paste and sautÈ. 4. Pour the cooked dal into the pan. 5. Add jaggery, tamarind pulp, and salt. 6. Simmer until flavors blend. 7. Garnish with chopped coriander leaves. 8. Serve with rice or chapati.

name: Gathiya
description: Crispy chickpea flour strands
ingredients: 2 cups Besan (gram flour), 1/2 tsp Ajwain (carom seeds), 1/2 tsp Baking soda, Salt to taste, 1/4 cup Oil, Water (as needed), Oil for frying
steps: 1. Mix besan, ajwain, baking soda, salt, and oil. 2. Gradually add water to form a smooth, stiff dough. 3. Use a sev press to make thin strands (gathiya). 4. Heat oil for frying and deep-fry until golden brown. 5. Drain excess oil and cool. 6. Store in an airtight container.

name: Kadhi Khichdi
description: Comforting one-pot meal
ingredients: 1 cup Rice, 1/2 cup Toor dal, 1/2 cup Moong dal, 1 cup Mixed vegetables (carrots, peas, beans), 1/2 cup Yogurt, 1/2 tsp Turmeric powder, 1 tsp Ginger-green chili paste, Salt to taste, 1 tbsp Ghee, 1 tsp Mustard seeds, 1 tsp Cumin seeds, 2 Dried red chilies, 5-6 Curry leaves, 2 tbsp Fresh coriander leaves (chopped)
steps: 1. Wash rice and dals together. 2. In a pressure cooker, combine rice, dals, mixed vegetables, yogurt, turmeric powder, ginger-green chili paste, and salt. 3. Pressure cook until done. 4. In a pan, heat ghee and add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, dried red chilies, and curry leaves. 5. Pour the tempering over the khichdi. 6. Garnish with chopped coriander leaves. 7. Serve hot.

name: Dabeli
description: Spicy and tangy stuffed burger
ingredients: 4 Pav (burger buns), 4 Potatoes (boiled and mashed), 1/2 cup Roasted peanuts, 1/4 cup Pomegranate seeds, 2 tbsp Dabeli masala, 2 tbsp Tamarind-date chutney, 2 tbsp Garlic chutney, 1/4 cup Sev, 2 tbsp Oil, Salt to taste, Butter (for toasting)
steps: 1. In a pan, heat oil and add mashed potatoes, dabeli masala, and salt. Cook until well combined. 2. Slice the pav horizontally without cutting all the way through. 3. Spread garlic chutney on one side and tamarind-date chutney on the other. 4. Stuff the pav with the potato mixture. 5. Heat a griddle and toast the stuffed pav with butter. 6. Garnish with roasted peanuts, pomegranate seeds, and sev. 7. Serve hot.

name: Methi Thepla Wrap
description: Flatbread roll with fenugreek
ingredients: 6 Methi Thepla (spiced flatbreads), 1 cup Paneer (grated), 1/2 cup Capsicum (sliced), 1/2 cup Onion (sliced), 1/4 cup Tomato (chopped), 1/4 cup Coriander leaves (chopped), 1 tsp Chaat masala, 1/2 tsp Cumin powder, Salt to taste, 2 tbsp Oil
steps: 1. Heat oil in a pan and sautÈ sliced capsicum and onion until tender. 2. Add grated paneer, chopped tomatoes, chaat masala, cumin powder, and salt. Mix well. 3. Warm the methi thepla. 4. Place a thepla on a flat surface and add the paneer mixture in the center. 5. Sprinkle chopped coriander leaves. 6. Roll the thepla into a wrap. 7. Repeat for the remaining theplas. 8. Serve as a delicious methi thepla wrap.

name: Bhakri Pizza
description: Flatbread pizza with Gujarati twist
ingredients: 4 Bhakri (sorghum flatbreads), 1/2 cup Tomato (sliced), 1/2 cup Bell peppers (sliced), 1/2 cup Onion (sliced), 1/2 cup Paneer (cubed), 1/2 cup Pizza sauce, 1 cup Mozzarella cheese (grated), 1 tsp Red chili flakes, 1 tsp Oregano, Salt to taste, 2 tbsp Oil
steps: 1. Preheat the oven to 200∞C (392∞F). 2. Place bhakris on a baking sheet. 3. Spread pizza sauce on each bhakri. 4. Layer with sliced tomatoes, bell peppers, onions, and paneer cubes. 5. Sprinkle grated mozzarella cheese, red chili flakes, oregano, and salt. 6. Bake in the oven until the cheese is melted and bubbly. 7. Remove from the oven, slice, and serve.

name: Tawa Pulao
description: Spiced rice stir-fry
ingredients: 2 cups Cooked rice, 1/2 cup Mixed vegetables (peas, carrots, beans), 1/2 cup Capsicum (sliced), 1/2 cup Onion (chopped), 2 Tomatoes (chopped), 2 tbsp Pav Bhaji masala, 1 tsp Red chili powder, 1/2 tsp Cumin seeds, 2 tbsp Ghee, Salt to taste, Fresh coriander leaves (chopped)
steps: 1. In a pan, heat ghee and add cumin seeds. 2. Add chopped onions and sautÈ until golden brown. 3. Add sliced capsicum, mixed vegetables, and chopped tomatoes. Cook until the vegetables are tender. 4. Add pav bhaji masala, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well. 5. Add cooked rice and stir-fry until the rice is well coated with the masala. 6. Garnish with chopped coriander leaves. 7. Serve hot.

name: Dal Dhokli
description: Wheat flour dumplings in lentil soup
ingredients: 1 cup Toor dal, 1 cup Wheat flour, 1/2 tsp Turmeric powder, 1 tsp Red chili powder, 1 tsp Cumin-coriander powder, 1 tsp Ginger-garlic paste, 2 tbsp Jaggery, Salt to taste, 1 tbsp Ghee, 1 tsp Mustard seeds, 1 tsp Cumin seeds, 5-6 Curry leaves, Fresh coriander leaves (chopped)
steps: 1. Cook toor dal with turmeric powder and salt until soft. 2. In a bowl, mix wheat flour, red chili powder, cumin-coriander powder, ginger-garlic paste, and salt. 3. Knead into a soft dough and roll into small dumplings (dhokli). 4. Add the dhokli to the cooked dal and simmer until the dhokli is cooked. 5. In a tempering pan, heat ghee and add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and curry leaves. 6. Pour the tempering over the dal dhokli. 7. Add jaggery and mix well. 8. Garnish with chopped coriander leaves. 9. Serve hot.

name: Gujarati Khandvi Rolls
description: Soft gram flour rolls with a twist
ingredients: Gujarati Khandvi (as per previous recipe), 1 cup Grated paneer, 1/2 cup Mixed bell peppers (finely chopped), 1/4 cup Fresh coriander leaves (chopped), 1 tbsp Olive oil, Salt and pepper to taste
steps: 1. Prepare Gujarati Khandvi as per the previous recipe. 2. In a pan, heat olive oil, add mixed bell peppers, and sautÈ until soft. 3. Add grated paneer, salt, and pepper to the mixture. 4. Spread the paneer and bell pepper mixture on the khandvi sheets. 5. Roll the sheets into khandvi rolls. 6. Garnish with chopped coriander leaves. 7. Serve as delightful khandvi rolls.

name: Mohantal

steps: 1. Cook field beans. 2. Prepare masala. 3. Combine and simmer. 4. Garnish with cilantro.

ingredients: Okra, Besan (Gram Flour), Turmeric Powder, Red Chili Powder, Coriander Powder, Amchur (Dried Mango Powder), Garam Masala, Salt, Oil
steps: 1. Slit okra. 2. Stuff with besan mixture. 3. Roast until crispy. 4. Stuffed Okra.

name: Matar Kachori
description: Spicy green pea-filled deep-fried pastries
ingredients: All-Purpose Flour, Green Peas, Green Chilies, Ginger, Garlic, Asafoetida (Hing), Cumin Seeds, Coriander-Cumin Powder, Turmeric Powder, Garam Masala, Salt, Oil, Water
steps: 1. Knead dough. 2. Make spicy pea filling. 3. Shape and deep-fry. 4. Kachori.

name: Gota

ingredients: Gram Flour (Besan), Yogurt, Ginger-Green Chili Paste, Turmeric Powder, Asafoetida (Hing), Baking Soda, Fenugreek Leaves (Methi), Coriander Leaves, Salt, Oil, Water
steps: 1. Mix besan, yogurt, and spices. 2. Drop spoonfuls into hot oil. 3. Fry until golden. 4. Drain excess oil. 5. Gota.

name: Doodhpak Ice Cream
description: Fusion dessert combining traditional doodhpak with ice cream
ingredients: Milk, Rice, Ghee, Sugar, Cardamom Powder, Nuts (Almonds, Cashews), Saffron Strands, Vanilla Ice Cream
steps: 1. Boil rice in milk. 2. Add sugar, cardamom, and nuts. 3. Cool and fold in ice cream. 4. Freeze until set.
